title: When the US might expect to get a Covid-19 vaccine
description: CNN's Elizabeth Cohen talks to Dr. Moncef Slaoui, chief adviser to "Operation Warp Speed," the federal government's Covid-19 vaccine program, about when Americans can expect a vaccine to be available and how effective it could be.

title: Obama gives most forceful address since leaving office and takes aim at Trump in eulogy for John Lewis
Caribbean finds there's no good answer to reopening
description: For many islands in the Caribbean, the coronavirus presents an impossible dilemma.

title: Joe Walsh: I don't give a damn if he's joking, he said it
description: Former Illinois Rep. Joe Walsh reacts to a tweet by President Donald Trump in which he suggests delaying November's presidential election.

title: Top Republicans openly challenge Trump's tweet on delaying election
A threat to democracy we all should have seen coming
description: When I read President Trump's Thursday morning tweet floating a "delay" of the presidential election, I thought back to the first weekend of his presidency.

title: Obama gives most forceful address since leaving office and takes aim at Trump in eulogy for John Lewis
description:
• Obama: 'America was built by John Lewises'
• John Lewis' final message for Americans

title: Mars launch: NASA sends Perseverance rover to space
description: The Perseverance rover is finally ready to launch on its journey to Mars on Thursday.

title: America's economy just had its worst quarter on record
Why some people who haven't had Covid-19 might already have some immunity
description: • Study finds higher viral load in young children

title: Fearing Trump interference, FBI agents hid copies of Russia investigation docs
description: Adapted from "TRUE CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS: The Investigation of Donald Trump," by Jeffrey Toobin. Copyright © 2020. Available from Doubleday.

title: The poacher who killed the rare silverback gorilla Rafiki is jailed for 11 years
description: A man has been jailed for 11 years in Uganda after he confessed to killing a rare silverback gorrilla last month.

title: Why some people who haven't had Covid-19 might already have some immunity
Herman Cain dies from coronavirus
description: Herman Cain, the former presidential candidate and former CEO of Godfather's Pizza, has died from coronavirus, according to an obituary sent from his verified Twitter account and Newsmax, where he was launching a television show.

title: A large number of congressional Republicans rejected Trump's suggestion the presidential election be delayed
description: A large number of congressional Republicans, including members of House and Senate leadership, openly rejected President Donald Trump's suggestion Thursday that November's presidential election should be delayed, a move that the President would have no authority to make because the Constitution gives Congress the power to set the date for voting.

title: Ex-Marine jailed for 9 years by Russian court. US envoy says trial was 'theater of the absurd'
description: A Moscow court sentenced former U.S. Marine Trevor Reed to nine years in prison Thursday for endangering "life and health" of Russian police officers in an altercation, state-run news agency TASS reported -- a sentence that drew swift condemnation from the top US diplomat in Russia.

title: Drew Barrymore interviews her 7-year-old self in promo for her new talk show
description: If Drew Barrymore's first promo for her upcoming syndicated daytime talk show is any indication, we're in for some fun.

title: No sex and no fans, but the beer is flowing fast in the NBA 'bubble'
Bizarre sculpture unveiled in the heart of London
description: A giant swirl of whipped cream topped with a cherry, a fly and a drone has become the latest artwork to sit atop Trafalgar Square's Fourth Plinth -- the stage for a constantly changing series of artworks.

title: Three sisters killed their father after years of sexual, physical and emotional abuse. Now they face murder charges
description: Mikhail Khachaturyan's body was found on a staircase in a Moscow apartment block in July 2018, with dozens of knife wounds to his chest and neck.

title: Ryan Reynolds helps reunite girl with stolen teddy bear with dying mother's voice
description: A Vancouver woman has been reunited with a teddy bear that has special significance for her.

title: Why people are so outraged by a video about cooking rice
description: On July 8, Malaysian comedian Nigel Ng uploaded to YouTube a video titled "DISGUSTED by this Egg Fried Rice Video," under his comedic persona "Uncle Roger."

title: Special prosecutor opens criminal proceedings against FIFA president
description: A special prosecutor appointed to look into undocumented meetings between Swiss Attorney General Michael Lauber and FIFA President Gianni Infantino has launched criminal proceedings against the head of world football and requested approval to open proceedings against Lauber, Swiss authorities announced on Thursday.

title: Middle East blasted with 123F heat amid electricity shortages and a pandemic
description: Several cities in the Middle East sweltered in temperatures of up to 51C (123F) this week, some of the hottest temperatures on record, amid the coronavirus pandemic and the upcoming Muslim celebration of Eid-al-Adha.

title: US economy posts worst drop on record
description:
• Unemployment claims rise for 2nd week in row
• Trump rolls back Obama-era fair housing rule

title: No, the Instagram 'challenge accepted' trend did not originate in Turkey
description: It seemed harmless enough at first. Celebrities and regular folks flooded Instagram feeds with black-and-white selfies and professionally shot photos of themselves with the caption #WomenSupportingWomen and "challenge accepted."

title: A new bestselling novel scrutinizes colorism and standards of beauty in America
description: While the world continues to reckon with systemic racism and anti-Blackness during a summer of protest and awakening after the killing of George Floyd, a new novel explores another layer of discrimination experienced by people within Black communities.

title: Yang reacts to Trump tweet suggesting election delay
description: CNN's Becky Anderson speaks to former Democratic presidential candidate Andrew Yang about President Trump's latest tweet suggesting delaying November's presidential election.

title: America's top tech CEOs can't agree on whether China steals from them
Flooding from sea level rise could cost our planet $14.2 trillion, study says
description: If the world does nothing to mitigate sea level rise, coastal flooding will become so extreme and destructive that it could cause damage worth up to 20% of global gross domestic product by 2100, according to new research.

title: Trump responds to Covid-19 death milestone with pseudo-science
description: • Trump again attempts to stoke racial divisions in housing message

title: Domino's New Zealand stops giving free pizzas to 'Karens' after backlash
description: Domino's in New Zealand has pulled a promotion offering free pizzas for "great" people named Karen following a backlash.

title: Dubai ruler pays hospital bills of mother stranded with quadruplets
description: Dubai's ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum will pay for the hospital expenses of a Nigerian mother and her quadruplets stranded in the country with mounting medical bills, the hospital said Wednesday.

title: Belarus says it's arrested Russian mercenaries, as rift grows between strongmen Putin and Lukashenko
description: Authorities in Belarus have announced the arrest of more than 30 Russian mercenaries accused of trying "to destabilize" the country ahead of August's presidential election, the state-run news agency Belta reported.

title: In Italy, masks have become a fashion statement not a political statement
description: CNN's Barbie Latza Nadeau reports from Rome on how Italians are attempting to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections by wearing masks.

title: Joshua Wong among multiple Hong Kong pro-democracy candidates disqualified from upcoming election
description: Multiple Hong Kong pro-democracy candidates have been disqualified from standing in upcoming legislative elections, amid reports the government may postpone the polls until next year over the coronavirus.

title: Zlatan Ibrahimovic compares himself to Benjamin Button after reaching new scoring milestone in Italy
description: Zlatan Ibrahimovic has compared himself to Benjamin Button after becoming the first man to score 50 league goals for both Milan clubs.

title: Botox could ease depression in addition to wrinkles, study finds
Airlines got travelers comfortable about flying again once before -- but 9/11 and a virus are a lot different
description: The US airline industry has generally faced two obstacles in enticing more people to fly: fear and fares.

title: Why celebrities are backing this baseless US conspiracy theory
description: A baseless claim about a child sex-trafficking ring, a Washington, DC pizzeria, and Hillary Clinton has been passed around among conspiracy theorists for more than three years. No evidence has emerged to support any part of the story. But last month, British pop star Robbie Williams used his voice to argue that the claims deserved more attention.

title: Japan recognizes dozens more 'black rain' victims as Hiroshima atomic bomb survivors
description: A Japanese court recognized dozens of victims of radioactive "black rain" as survivors of the Hiroshima atomic bombing on Wednesday, clearing the way for them to receive medical benefits just days before the 75th anniversary of the attack.

title: Archaeologists discover the likely source of Stonehenge's giant sarsen stones
description: For centuries, the source of Stonehenge's massive sarsen stones  have been an open mystery.

title: Trump rolls back on Obama-era fair housing rule
description: President Donald Trump is seeking to stoke racial divisions with an administrative rule change, rolling back on an Obama-era fair housing rule meant to combat segregation.

title: Doctor reacts to scene at Trump's Texas event: Depressing, distressing and dumb
description: Dr. William Schaffner, professor of infectious diseases at Vanderbilt University, reacts to President Donald Trump attending a Texas event where few people were seen wearing masks and there was no evidence of social distancing.
